background: A hospital patient needs medication, with the option to take two different pain killers. Each pain killer contributes different amounts of medicine to various parts of the body and includes a sleep medicine component.
constraints: Number of doses of pain killer 1 is non-negative
Number of doses of pain killer 2 is non-negative
Total amount of sleep medicine from both pain killers is at most MaxSleepMedicine units
Total amount of leg medicine from both pain killers is at least MinLegMedicine units
objective: Maximize the total amount of medicine delivered to the back
description: A patient in the hospital can take two different pain killers, pain killer 1 and pain killer 2. Per dose, pain killer 1 delivers \param{LegMedicinePainKiller1} units of medicine to the legs and \param{BackMedicinePainKiller1} units of medicine to the back. Per dose, pain killer 2 delivers \param{LegMedicinePainKiller2} units of medicine to the legs and \param{BackMedicinePainKiller2} units of medicine to the back. In addition, pain killer 1 delivers \param{SleepMedicinePainKiller1} units of sleeping medicine and pain killer 2 delivers \param{SleepMedicinePainKiller2} units of sleeping medicine. At most \param{MaxSleepMedicine} units of sleep medicine should be delivered and at least \param{MinLegMedicine} units of medicine should be delivered to the legs. How many doses of each should be taken to maximize the amount of medicine delivered to the back?

parameters.definition: Amount of leg medicine per dose of pain killer 1
Amount of back medicine per dose of pain killer 1
Amount of leg medicine per dose of pain killer 2
Amount of back medicine per dose of pain killer 2
Amount of sleep medicine per dose of pain killer 1
Amount of sleep medicine per dose of pain killer 2
Maximum units of sleep medicine allowed
Minimum units of leg medicine required
